question: Hello?... Who's there? You scared me to death, you mangy thing! I'm just looking for an old well. Know it? Not talking, huh? Magic dowser, magic dowser
answer: Ow!

question: And I DON'T LIKE BEING STALKED, not by
answer: He's not really my cat; he's kinda feral  you know, wild? Of course, I do feed him every night and sometimes he'll come in my window `n bring me little dead things. Huh?

question: MICHIGAN? And if I'm a "water witch",
answer: You stomp too hard and you'll fall in it! See? Supposed to be so deep if you fell to the bottom and looked up, you'd see a sky full of stars in the middle of the day. Surprised she let you move in... ... my Gramma. She owns the "Pink Palace" Won't rent to people with kids.

question: What do you mean?
answer: Uh... I'm not supposed to talk about it. I'm Wybie, Wybie Lovat. Short for Wyborne. Not my idea, of course. What'd you get saddled with?

question: I wasn't saddled with anything. It's Coraline.
answer: Caroline what?

question: Coraline. Coraline Jones.
answer: Hmmm... It's not real scientific, but I heard an ordinary name, like Caroline -- -- can lead people to have ordinary expectations about a person--

question: Ehh!! I almost fell down a well yesterday, Mom.
answer: Uh huh.

question: I would have died.
answer: That's nice.

question: Hmmm. So can I go out? I think it's perfect weather for gardening.
answer: No, Coraline. Rain makes mud. Mud makes a mess.

question: But Mom, I want stuff growing when my friends come to visit. Isn't that why we moved here?
answer: Something like that. But then we had the accident.

question: Wasn't my fault you hit that truck.
answer: I never said it was. Coraline, I don't have time for you right now. And you still have unpacking to do. Lots of unpacking.

question: Wybie. And I'm way too old for dolls. Hey Dad, how's the writing going?... Dad?
answer: Hello, Coraline... And... Coraline doll?...

question: D'you know where the garden tools are?
answer: It's pouring out there, isn't it.

question: Humph, it's just raining.
answer: What'd the boss say? Then you won't need the tools. Uhhh, you know, this house is a hundred and fifty years old.

question: So?
answer: So explore it! Go out and ... count all the doors and windows and write that down. List everything blue!

question: Ewww! Ahh!!
answer: No, no, no, no, no; GAAAA--! --AAAAAAA!

question: One boring blue boy in a painfully boring painting ... four incredibly boring windows ... and no... more... doors... All right, little me, where are you hiding? Huh? Hey Mom... Where does this door go?
answer: I'm really, really busy!

question: I think it's locked. Pleeeeeeeeease!
answer: Uhhh... Will you stop pestering me if I do this for you? Fine.

question: Bricks? I don't get it.
answer: They must have closed this off when they divided up the house.

question: You're kidding? And why is the door so small?
answer: We made a deal. ZIP IT!

question: You didn't lock it.
answer: AaaaaH!!!

question: Think they're trying to poison me? Don't forget about me, guys. Okay? Good-night...little me. Whoa... Huh? MMMMM, something smells good. Mom?! What are you doing here in the middle of the night?
answer: You're just in time for supper, dear!

question: You're not my mother. My mother doesn't have b-b-buh...
answer: B-b-b-buttons? Do you like them? I'm your Other Mother, silly. Now go tell your Other Father that supper's ready. Well, go on. He's in his study.

question: Hello?
answer: Hello, Coraline. Want to hear my new song?

question: My father can't play piano.
answer: No need to ... this piano plays ME! Making up a song about Coraline. She's a peach, she's a doll, she's a pal of mine. She's as cute as a button in the eyes of everyone who ever laid their eyes on Cor- a-line. When she comes around exploring Mom and I will never ever make it boring our eyes will be on Coraline.

question: I, uh  sorry  but she said to tell you the food's ready.
answer: Mmmmm! Who's starving? Raise your hand. We give our thanks and ask to bless, Our Mother's golden chicken breast!

question: Mmmm, this chicken is good.
answer: Hungry, aren't you.

question: D'you have any gravy?
answer: Well, here comes the gravy train! Choo- choo! Another roll, sweet peas? Corn on the cob?

question: I'm real thirsty.
answer: Of course! Any requests?

question: Mango milk shake? Home?
answer: We've been waiting for you, Coraline.

question: I didn't know I had an Other Mother.
answer: Of course you do. Everyone does.

question: Really?
answer: Uh huh, and soon as you're through eating, I thought we'd play a game. Perfect! Hide and seek in the rain.

question: Miss Spink and Forcible? But you said they're dingbats. Bo-bin-sky...Bo-bin-sky....Bo-bin-sky... Ohh, Poo-eeeee! H-hello?... I think our mail got mixed up. Should I leave it outside or... Hmmm... Huh?
answer: New "cheese" samples. Very clever, using this "mix up" to sneak my home and peek at meeshkas

question: Meeshkas?
answer: The Mice!

question: Oh, sorry. I'm Coraline Jones.
answer: Ha! You see, Caroline, the problem is my new songs go oompah oompah. But the jumping mice play only toodle toot, like that. Is nice, but not so much amazing? So now-- --I switch to stronger cheese, and soon Here, have beet. Make you strong. Daas vee DAAN ya, Caroline.

question: Cor-a-line. Oompah oompah, toodle toot, toodle toot.
answer: EHHH! CAROLINE

question: No!!!
answer: The mice...asked me to give you message.

question: The...jumping mice?
answer: They are saying

question: The one behind the wall paper? But... it's all bricked up.
answer: Bah. So sorry, is nothing. Sometimes the mice are leetle... ...mixed up, hmmm? They even get your name wrong, you know. They call you Coraline instead of Caroline, not Caroline at all. Maybe I work them too hard...

question: Miriam, put the kettle on!
answer: April, I think you're being followed.

question: It's the new neighbor, Miriam - Caroline? She'll be having the Oolong tea.
answer: No, no, no, no. I'm sure she'd prefer Jasmine.

question: No, Oolong.
answer: Ah, Jasmine it is, then.

question: Come on, boys! Now, there's Hamish the third, the fourth, the eighth, the ninth. Angus the second, the fifth, the..
answer: Oh go on, have one  it's hand-pulled taffy from Brighton  best in the world.

question: Danger?
answer: Owwwwwwww!

question: Great, the village stalker.
answer: Ow. I - I wasn't stalking you. We're hunting banana slugs.

question: What d'ya mean, "we?" Ha! Your cat's not wild, he's a wuss- puss!
answer: What? He hates to get his feet wet. Geez.

question: So... that doll. Did you make it look like me?
answer: Oh no; I found it that way. It's older than Gramma -- old as this house prob'ly.

question: C'mom - blue hair, my swampers and raincoat?
answer: Dang, check out Slugzilla! Huh?

question: I meant my parents; they don't listen to me either.
answer: Uh huh... You mind?

question: Ew!
answer: You know, I've never been inside the Pink Palace. Grandma would kill me. Thinks it's dangerous or something.

question: Dangerous?
answer: Well... she had a twin sister.

question: So? Well, what do you think?
answer: Uhhh, I-I don't know. Maybe she just ran away?

question: Wait a minute!
answer: Welcome back, darling.

question: Hi.
answer: So thoughtful of you to send this nice cheddar, Coraline.

question: Cheddar?... Oh, the mice bait...
answer: Would you go fetch your father? Bet he's hungry as a pumpkin by now!

question: You mean my Other Father?
answer: Your better father, dear. He's out in the garden.

question: Mmmmmm!
answer: Go on...

question: Hey!!!
answer: I love your garden!

question: Our garden, Coraline! Oops, daughter in distress! Tickle no more, you dragon snappers!
answer: Well, she says it's time for dinner ... breakfast ... food?

question: Hop on, kiddo, I want to show you something!
answer: I can't believe you did this!

question: Mother said you'd like it! Boy she knows you like the back of her hand.
answer: Mmmm...so good!

question: Your father and I will clean up while you and your friend head upstairs.
answer: My friend? Great... another Wybie. Hello, Why-were- you-born. Hello?

question: I thought you'd like him more, if he spoke a little less. So I fixed him.
answer: So he can't talk at all?

question: Nope.
answer: Hmm, I like it. You're awful cheerful, considering you can't say anything. Uh...It didn't hurt, did it, when she... Whoa... cool! Look at you!

question: Hmm, I like it. You're awful cheerful, considering you can't say anything. Uh...It didn't hurt, did it, when she... Whoa... cool! Look at you!
answer: Lady and gentleman! For to tickle your eyes and ears and making hearts to thump, I  Sergei Alexander Bobinsky  am introducing... ... my as-tound-ishing, stu-pen-dulous and AH-MAZING Jumping Mouse Circus!

question: It's wonderful, Wybie! Wow! Yah! Whooo-oooh! That was great!
answer: Very very thank you, lady and gentleman.

question: We loved it, Mr. B. It was ... so ... so-- A-mazing!
answer: You are very velcome anytime you like, you and also your good friend there. Dosvedanya, Coraline.

question: Da-ad! I'm not five anymore.
answer: Put them back.

question: But Mom, the whole school's gonna wear boring gray clothes. No one will have these.
answer: Put them back.

question: My other mother would get them.
answer: Maybe she should buy all your clothes.

question: So what do you think's in the other apartment?
answer: I don't know. Not a family of Jones imposters.

question: Then why'd you lock the door?
answer: Oh, I found some rat crap and... I thought you'd feel ... safer.

question: They're jumping-mice, Mom! And the dreams aren't dangerous; they're the most fun I've had since we've moved here.
answer: Your school might be fun.

question: With those stupid uniforms? Right.
answer: Had to give it a try. How do you feel about a mustard-ketchup- salsa wrap for lunch?

question: Are you kidding me?
answer: Mmm... Had to go food shopping anyway. Dad's planning something special.

question: Gross-gusting. Oh, like the gloves?
answer: Look, Coraline... if things go well today, I promise I'll make it up.

question: That's what you always say.
answer: Won't be long.

question: Hmmm... Wybie's got a cat like you at home. Not the quiet Wybie; the one that talks too much. You must be the Other Cat.
answer: No. I'm not the other anything. I'm me.

question: Um... I can see you don't have button eyes. But if you're the same cat, how can you talk?
answer: I just can.

question: Cats don't talk at home.
answer: No?

question: Nope. Come back. Please? I... I'm sorry I called you that, I really am. How'd you get here?
answer: I've been coming here for a while. It's a game we play. She... ...hates cats and tries to keep me out. But she can't, of course. I come and go as I please.

question: What do you mean? She's amazing!
answer: You probably think this world is a dream come true. But you're wrong. The Other Wybie told me so.

question: That's nonsense. He can't talk.
answer: Perhaps not to you. We cats, however, have far superior senses than humans and can see and smell, and --

question: A big-bottomed sea witch may bob through the waves, And hope to lead sailors astray, But a true ocean goddess, Must fill out her bodice, To present an alluring display.
answer: Beware of old oysters, too large in the chest, Let's banish them from the buffet. I'm far more nutritious

question: You smell like the fishes
answer: Did I hear a banshee?

question: You're sea-green with envy
answer: This mermaid enchantress,

question: No, I "Birth of Venus!"
answer: Will send sailors swooning --oh--! Ready to break a leg, Miriam?

question: Was it wonderful, dear?
answer: Oh yeah. They swooped down and pulled me right out of my seat  Spink and Forcible. Only they weren't old ladies, that was just a disguise. But then, I was flying through the air and... it was, it was magic.

question: You do like it here, don't you, Coraline?
answer: Uh-huh! Good night, Wybie.

question: You could stay here forever... if you want to.
answer: Really?

question: I'm really, really tired. Yeah... I just need to sleep on things.
answer: Well of course you do, darling... I'll be happy to tuck you in.

question: Oh, no thanks, uh, you-you've done so much already--
answer: You're welcome. And I  we aren't worried at all, darling.

question: I'm going home tonight, robots - and I won't be back. Go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep, go to sleep! Go to sleep, go to sleep...
answer: There's just one tiny little thing we have to do.

question: And what do you think you're doing?
answer: Well, I'm gettin' outta here. That's what I'M doing. Huh? Something's wrong. Shouldn't the old well be here?

question: Nothing out here ... it's the empty part of this world. She only made what she knew would impress you.
answer: But why? Why does she want me? Eat? That's ridiculous, mothers don't eat daughters!

question: I don't know. How do you taste?
answer: Huh? But how can you walk away from something and still come back to it?

question: Walk around the world.
answer: Small world.

question: Hang on--
answer: Stop, he's one of the circus mice!

question: I don't like rats at the best of times, but this one was sounding an alarm.
answer: Gooooood kitty.

question: Gooooood kitty.
answer: They say even the proudest -- --spirit can be broken ... with love. Of course, chocolate never hurts. Like one? They're Cocoa Beetles from Zanzibar.

question: I want to be with my real mom and dad. I want you to let me go.
answer: Is that any way to talk to your mother?

question: You aren't my mother.
answer: Apologize at once, Coraline!

question: No.
I ... I'll try. Did she do this to you? I hope that feels bet--
answer: Coraline? Is that you!

question: Let's go!
answer: Coraline...

question: Come on. She'll hurt you again!
answer: Coraline? How dare you disobey your mother!! Coraline!

question: I'M HOME! Anybody here? Hello, hello, hello! Real Dad ... Real Mom! Oh, Mom's groceries! I missed you guys so much-- You'll never-- Oh... the Wybie that talks...
answer: Huh? Ha ha ha....yeah... Um, so you know tha-that old doll I gave you? Um... my Gramma's real mad, says it was her sister's - the one that... disappeared?

question: It used to look like this pioneer girl; then Huck Finn junior; then it was this Little Rascals chick with all these ribbons, and braids, and.... Grandma's missing sister! I think I just met her. C'mon!
answer: Uh, listen, I-I-I'm really not supposed

question: She's in there.
answer: C-can you  can you unlock it?

question: Not in a million years. But it wouldn't matter; she can't escape without her eyes. None of the ghosts can.
answer: Huhhhhhh... So, uh, I really need to get that doll?

question: Great! I'd love to get rid of it! Where are you hiding, you little monster?!
answer: You and Gramma been talking?

question: The doll's her spy! It's how she watches you, finds out what's wrong with your life!
answer: The doll...is my Gramma's...spy.

question: NO! - the Other Mother! She's got this whole world where everything's better - the food, the garden, the-- --neighbors. But it's all a trap!
answer: Yeah... Uh, I think I heard someone calling me, Jonesy.

question: Don't believe me?... You can ask the cat!
answer: The cat... I-I'll just tell Gramma that you couldn't find the doll-- OW!

question: You're not LISTENING TO ME!
answer: That's ... cause ... you're CRAZY!

question: You creep!
answer: Crazy!!

question: Crazy?... You're the jerk-wad that gave me the doll! Mom! Dad! Pick it up, Dad, pick it up.
answer: Hi!

question: Dad! Whe-
answer: I'm digging in my garden right now, but leave a message and I'll get right back to you.

question: Just looking ahead dear... Angus hasn't been feeling very well of late.
answer: April? Aren't you getting ready?

question: We've lost our ride, Miriam. Caroline says her parents have vanished, quite completely.
answer: What?! We've waited months for those tickets.

question: I suppose we could walk!
answer: With your gamy legs? It's nearly two miles to the theater!

question: Oh, oh yes ... your missing parents. We know just what you need. Miriam, get...that's right.
answer: How is hundred-year-old candy going to

question: There you go, sweety.
answer: What's it for?

question: Well,it might help. They're good for bad things, sometimes.
answer: No, they're good for lost things.

question: It's bad things, Miriam.
answer: Lost things, April.

question: Bad.
answer: Lost.

question: Bad things!
answer: Lost.

question: Bad.
answer: Lost.

question: Good-night, Mom. Good-night, Dad. Hello. How did you get in? Do you know where Mom and Dad are? MOM! DAD!! How did this happen? She's taken them. They're not coming back, are they  Mom and Dad. Not on their own. Only one thing to do.
answer: You know, you're walking right into her trap.

question: I have to go back. They are my parents.
answer: Challenge her then. She may not play fair but she won't refuse. She's got a thing for games.

question: My real parents. And, and the eyes of the ghost children.
answer: Huh. What if you don't find them?

question: If I lose, I'll stay here with you forever and let you love me. And I'll let you sew buttons into my eyes.
answer: Hmmm... And if you somehow win this game?

question: Then you let me go. You let everyone go  my real father and mother, the dead children, everyone you've trapped here.
answer: Deal.

question: Not till you give me a clue.
answer: Oh, right... In each of three wonders I've made just for you, a ghost's eye is lost in plain sight.

question: Oh, Wybie... EVIL WITCH ... I'M NOT SCARED!
answer: Hello, ga-LOO-boo-shka.

question: I'm Coraline.
answer: Is dis vhat you're looking for?

question: Uh-huh.
answer: You tink vinning game is goot ting? If you stay here, you can have vhatever you vant, vsig-DA - alvays.

question: You don't get it, do you?
answer: I don't understand.

question: Of course you don't understand. You're just a copy she made of the real Mr. B.
answer: Not even that anymore.

question: Ahhh! No!! NOOOO! Noooo!
answer: I think I mentioned that I don't like rats at the best of times.

question: I think you might have said something like that.
answer: It looked like you needed this one, however.

question: Thank you. I'm heading inside. I still have to find my parents. Come on, quickly!
answer: So, you're back.... And you brought vermin with you.

question: No, I ... I brought a friend. You, you have a very funny way of showing it.
answer: So? Where are they - the ghost eyes?

question: Hold on. We aren't finished yet, are we?
answer: No, I suppose not. After all, you still need to find your old parents, don't you? Too bad you won't have this.

question: Go on. Open it. They'll be there, all right.
answer: You're wrong, Coraline! Now you're going to stay here forever.

question: No ... I'm ... NOT!
answer: NOOOOOOOOO! You horrible cheating girl! Noo!! Where are you? You selfish brat!! Hahahaha... ... DISOBEY YOUR MOTHER??!!

question: PLEASE...SHUT!!
answer: DON'T LEAVE ME! DON'T LEAVE ME!!! I'LL

question: Coraline? We're home!
answer: Mom! Dad! I missed you so much!

question: Missed us? Oh no, you broke my favorite snow globe.
answer: I didn't break it. It must've broke when you escaped.

question: But look at the snow on your clothes...? So, gonna order the tulips?
answer: What's that?

question: For the garden party!!
answer: I have no idea what you're talking about.

question: I -- I've gotta hide this somewhere, s- somewhere she can never ... Outta my way! Oh.... my twitchy witchy girl, I think you are so nice ... ... I give you bowls of porridge And I give you bowls of ice cream. I give you lots of kisses, And I give you lots of hugs ... ... But I never give you sandwiches With grease and worms and mung beans.
answer: YAHHHHH!!!! I-I'm really sorry I didn't believe you about all this ... evil stuff, Coraline.

question: Why did you change your mind?
answer: W-well, Gramma showed me this picture, after I called you crazy? It's her and her sister, before she disappeared.

question: Oh, man...what am I going to tell her?
answer: Just bring her by the house tomorrow. We can tell her together.

question: We...we can??
answer: You know, I'm glad you decided to stalk me.

question: Wasn't my idea.
answer: Thanks for helping me, Miss Spink, Miss Forcible.

question: How are the meeshkas, Mr. B?
answer: Wyborne, I know where I'm going--

question: Welcome, Ms. Lovat!
answer: Oh, hello.
